slowcontrol/separator/frontend.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         frontend.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     Example Slow Control Frontend program. Defines two
00007                 slow control equipments, one for a HV device and one
00008                 for a multimeter (usually a general purpose PC plug-in
00009                 card with A/D inputs/outputs. As a device driver,
00010                 the "null" driver is used which simulates a device
00011                 without accessing any hardware. The used class drivers
00012                 cd_hv and cd_multi act as a link between the ODB and
00013                 the equipment and contain some functionality like
00014                 ramping etc. To form a fully functional frontend,
00015                 the device driver "null" has to be replaces with
00016                 real device drivers.
00017 
00018 
00019   $Log: frontend.c,v $
00020   Revision 1.1.1.1  2004/10/20 18:41:18  admin
00021   Trying again to import midas-1.9.5.  There are NT executables, but I'm importing them as well (w/o -kb switch so watch out!)

00084 /* The frontend file name, don't change it */

00088 BOOL frontend_call_loop = TRUE;

00109 typedef struct SEPARATOR_DATA_Struct {

00112   float vac;

00114 } SEPARATOR_DATA;

00117 
00118 EQUIPMENT equipment[] = {
00119    {"SeparatorMonitor",            /* equipment name */
00120      { 22, 0,                       /* event ID, trigger mask */
00121        "SYSTEM",                   /* event buffer */
00122        EQ_PERIODIC,                  /* equipment type */
00123        0,                          /* event source */
00124        "MIDAS",                    /* format */
00125        TRUE,                       /* enabled */
00126        RO_ALWAYS|RO_ODB,           /* read all the time */
00127        50000,                      /* reads spaced by this many ms */
00128        0,                          /* stop run after this event limit */
00129        0,                          /* number of sub events */
00130        0,                          /* log history every event */
00131        "", "", "", },
00132     read_separator_event,              /* readout routine */
00133     NULL, NULL, 
00134     separator_bank_list,
00135    },
00136

00166 /*-- Frontend Init -------------------------------------------------*/
00167 
00168 INT frontend_init()
00169 {
00170 
00171   // get the LabView filename
00172   cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
00173   
00174   if(db_find_key(hDB, 0, Alarm, &hKey) != SUCCESS){
00175     db_create_key(hDB,0,Alarm,TID_INT);
00176   }
00177 
00178   return CM_SUCCESS;
00179 }
00180

00190 INT frontend_loop()
00191 {
00192    ss_sleep(100);
00193    return CM_SUCCESS;
00194 }

00226 INT read_separator_event(char *pevent, INT off){
00227   static SEPARATOR_DATA separator_data;
00228 
00229   static char oldtimestamp[80];
00230   char timestamp[80];
00231   char timestring[80];
00232   FILE *infile=NULL;
00233   float *pdata;
00234   static float lastHVs[4] = {-1., -1., -1., -1.};
00235   static int initDone = 0;
00236   int i;
00237 
00238   size = sizeof(sepDemand);
00239   db_get_value(hDB,0, "/Experiment/Edit on start/Separator HV",
00240                &sepDemand, &size, TID_INT, 1);
00241 
00242   timestamp[0]='\0';
00243 
00244   infile=fopen("/tmp/separator.txt","r");
00245   if (infile==NULL){
00246     cm_msg(MERROR,frontend_name,
00247            "Could not open tempfile. separator_daemon.pl not running?");
00248     separator_data.hv =-1;
00249     separator_data.vac =-1;
00250     separator_data.sep_stat =-1;
00251   }
00252   else{
00253     fscanf(infile,"%s\n%f\n%f\n%f\n%f",timestamp,&separator_data.hv,
00254            &separator_data.current,&separator_data.vac,
00255            &separator_data.sep_stat);
00256     fclose(infile);
00257     
00258     if(!strcmp(oldtimestamp, timestamp)){
00259       separator_data.hv=-1;
00260       separator_data.vac=-1;
00261       separator_data.sep_stat=-1;
00262     }
00263   }  
00264   
00265   if(initDone == 0){
00266     for(i=0; i<4; i++) lastHVs[i] = separator_data.hv;
00267     initDone = 1;
00268   }
00269   else{
00270     for(i=0; i<3; i++) lastHVs[i] = lastHVs[i+1];
00271     lastHVs[3] = separator_data.hv;
00272   }
00273 
00274   //for(i=0; i<4; i++) printf("HV[%d]=%d\n",i,(int)lastHVs[i]);
00275   //printf("Demand = %d\n", sepDemand);
00276 
00277   //Send to midas:
00278   bk_init(pevent);
00279   bk_create(pevent,"SEPA",TID_FLOAT,&pdata);
00280   pdata[0] = separator_data.hv;
00281   pdata[1] = separator_data.current;
00282   pdata[2] = separator_data.vac;
00283   pdata[3] = separator_data.sep_stat;
00284   bk_close(pevent,pdata+4);
00285 
00286   int sepError = 1;
00287 
00288   for(i=0; i<4; i++){
00289     if((int)lastHVs[i] == sepDemand) sepError = 0;
00290   }
00291 
00292   if(sepError==1){
00293     if(strcmp(oldtimestamp, timestamp)){
00294       cm_msg(MERROR,frontend_name,"Separator high voltage not same as demand!");
00295       printf("Demand = %d", sepDemand);
00296     }
00297     else{
00298       cm_msg(MERROR,frontend_name,"Old and new timestamps identical."
00299              " Refresh too high or separator_daemon.pl not running.");
00300     }
00301     int on = 1;
00302     db_set_value(hDB, 0, Alarm, &on, sizeof(on), 1, TID_INT);
00303   }
00304   else{
00305     int off = 0;
00306     db_set_value(hDB, 0, Alarm, &off, sizeof(off), 1, TID_INT);
00307   }
00308 
00309   strcpy(oldtimestamp,timestamp);
00310   
00311   return bk_size(pevent);
00312 }
